item.title: martianlantern ‚Äî Updating my Bash Prompt
item.description: On a late sunday night I started tinkering around with my bash profiles and came to realize I can very much optimize my terminal experience. The figure on the left shows what my terminal looks like currently. The prefix before the $ sign does not contain a lot of information which I can use in my current directory. It displays three things in order, the current host, current dir and the user name

item.title: Mandeep Bhutani
item.description: About six months after I finished my PC build, I started running into serious stability issues. Randomly, the display would cut to black and the GPU fans would instantly rev up to 100%.

item.title: Why Gophers Hate ORMs
item.description: Last year, when I started learning Golang, and while building a project, I needed to work with databases. I stumbled upon an interesting conundrum in the Golang community: Everyone here seems to hate ORMs. I wondered why. Coming from ecosystems like Python (Django/SQLAlchemy), the ORM is usually the default starting point. Although I went my way with writing SQL queries by hand for that specific project, recently this question again resurfaced in my mind.

item.title: Framework Laptop 13 gets ARM processor with 12 cores via upgrade kit
item.description: The Framework Laptop 13 has a replaceable mainboard, which means that the processor can be easily upgraded after purchase. While Framework itself only offers Intel and AMD CPUs, a mainboard with a high-performance ARM processor from a third-party manufacturer has now launched.

item.title: Particle Dynamics // Physics For Game Dev #1
item.description:
This video introduces physics for game developers and is the first in a series to build a physics engine that can be used for multiple purposes.
üî• See the list of the books that I'm using as background information for my tutorials: https://ogldev.org/books.html. I highly recommend them for learning more about OpenGL and Vulkan. These are affiliate links so if you use them to buy any of the books the price is the same for you and I will get a small commission (thank-you!).
üìö Timecodes üìö 0:00 Intro 1:41 Particle background 3:00 1-D Kinematics 3:25 Velocity 5:45 Acceleration 7:40 Moving to 3D 8:29 Dynamics 9:05 First law of motion 9:55 Second law of motion 11:08 Outro
üî•Please visit https://ogldev.org to see more of my tutorials on modern OpenGL.
üî•Link to source: https://github.com/emeiri/ogldev/
Feel free to comment below.
